Grabbe stresses the many parallels between what we today call prophetic writings and apocalyptic writings. He suggests that apocalyptic is best seen as a sub-genre of prophecy though likely social changes might well have influenced the form of any given prophetic writing and its themes or outlook, Grabbe, Judaic Religion, 234–35; contrast Ben Witherington, Jesus the Seer: The Progress of Prophecy
